contextId.information: Here the word "was" is understood. AT: "Isaac was the father ... Jacob was the father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Isaac the father ... Jacob the father

contextId.information: Here the word "was" is understood. AT: "Perez was the father ... Hezron was the father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Perez the father ... Hezron the father

contextId.information: Here the word "was" is understood. AT: "Amminadab was the father ... Nahshon was the father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Amminadab the father ... Nahshon the father

contextId.information: Here the word "was" is understood. AT: "Boaz was the father ... Obed was the father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Boaz the father ... Obed the father

contextId.information: The word "was" is understood in both of these phrases. AT: "Rehoboam was the father of Abijah, and Abijah was the father of Asa" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asa

contextId.information: The phrase "need a physician" is understood. AT: "people who are sick need a physician" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: those who are sick

contextId.information: The full content of their answer is not stated, but it is understood. AT: "Yes, Lord, we believe you can heal us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Yes, Lord

contextId.information: There is information here that is not stated, but it is understood. AT: "I helped you and taught you God's truth for free. Therefore, you should not make other people pay for you to help them or to teach them God's truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Freely you have received, freely give

contextId.information: The phrase "a father his child" can be translated as a complete sentence. AT: "Brothers will deliver up their brothers to death, and fathers will deliver up their children to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Brother will deliver up brother to death, and a father his child

contextId.information: You can make explicit the information that is understood. AT: "I will also acknowledge before my Father who is in heaven that these people belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven

contextId.information: You can make explicit the information that is understood. AT: "I will deny before my Father who is in heaven that this person belongs to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven

contextId.information: The details of the message the person told Jesus are understood and not repeated here. AT: "who told Jesus that his mother and brothers wanted to speak to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: who told him

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information as was done in the UDB. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty

contextId.information: The phrase "as much as was planted" is understood following each of these numbers. AT: "Some people produce 100 times as much as was planted, some produce 60 times as much, and some produce 30 times as much." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:mat:13:07|13:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: yielding one hundred times as much as was planted, some sixty, and some thirty times as much

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "the other side of the lake" or "the other side of the Sea of Galilee" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the other side

contextId.information: The understood information can be made clear. AT: "but it was my Father in heaven who revealed this to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: but my Father who is in heaven

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "and marries another woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and marries another

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "begin with the workers I hired last, then pay the workers I hired first" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: beginning from the last to the first

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "but to serve other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: but to serve

contextId.information: The understood information can be made clear. AT: "And you also say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: And

contextId.information: The understood information can be stated clearly. AT: "Or when did we see you thirsty ... Or when did we see you naked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Or thirsty ... Or naked

contextId.information: The words "I was" preceding "naked" are understood. AT: "I was naked, but you did not give me clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: naked, but you did not clothe me

contextId.information: The understood information can be made clear. AT: "but the King will send the righteous to the place where they will live forever with God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: but the righteous into eternal life

contextId.information: What the leaders did not want to do during the feast can be made more clear. AT: "We should not kill Jesus during the feast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Not during the feast

contextId.information: The understood information can be stated clearly. AT: "if they deceive people by saying that, it will be worse than the way he deceived people before by saying that he was the Christ" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and the last deception will be worse than the first
